General.text:
Type:
Neuromuscular blocker
Dosage Forms:
Common Trade Names:

Adult_Dosing.text:
Calculate based on ideal body weight
Intubation dose: bolus 0.06-0.1 mg/kg IV
Maintenance: 0.015-0.1 mg/kg IV q30-60min OR continuous infusion: 0.1 mg/kg/hr IV

Pediatric_Dosing.text:
Neonates
Load: 0.02 mg/kg IV
Maintenance: 0.05-0.1 mg/kg IV q0.5-4hr PRN
>1mo
Load: 0.04-0.1 mg/kg IV
Maintenance: 0.015-0.1 mg/kg IV q30-60min OR continual infusion: 0.1 mg/kg/hr IV

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C
Lactation: Unknown
Renal Dosing
CrCl 10-50 mL/min: Administer 50% normal dose
CrCl <10 mL/min: Do not use
Hepatic Dosing: Use caution

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug or bromides
Caution if:
Following opioid, sedative or anesthetic agent (additive/synergistic effects)
Poor renal perfusion or severe renal disease
Preexisting tachycardia
>25% TBSA burns
HyperMg, hypoK, hypoCa (increased sensitivity)

Serious.text:
Anaphylaxis
Tachycardia, dose related
Bronchospasm
Hypotension

Common.text:
Tachycardia
Hypertension
Excessive salivation
Excessive sweating
Rash
Wheezing

Serious.text:
Anaphylaxis

Hypotension

Tachycardia

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 2h
Metabolism: primarily none
Excretion: Urinary
Mechanism of Action: Non-depolarizing skeletal muscle relaxant; cholinergic receptor antagonist
